body: A shock awaited James Solomon when he returned to his Brooklyn apartment after a week away from the city last last winter: the lock on his door had been changed. He phoned his landlady, who gave him the surprising news that he had been evicted. Mr. Solomon had been living in a spacious rent-controlled apartment in the Bedford-Stuyvesant section
